intro: Callitriche elegans f. spathulifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf water starwort, is a semi-aquatic flowering plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems that often float on the surface of freshwater bodies. The leaves are typically oval to spatulate in shape, which is reflected in its specific epithet "spathulifolia." It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. This plant is often found in shallow, still waters and is known for its ability to thrive in moist, nutrient-rich environments.
